alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Gloucester; Salem (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 29 at 5:31PM EDT until July 29 at 5:45PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EDT FOR NORTH CENTRAL CUMBERLAND...CENTRAL SALEM AND NORTHWESTERN GLOUCESTER COUNTIES... At 531 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Swedesboro, or 12 miles east of Wilmington, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Wind damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. Locations impacted include... Wilmington, Pennsville, Carneys Point, New Castle, Penns Grove, Salem, Woodstown, Alloway, Swedesboro, Beckett, Mullica Hill and Delaware Memorial Bridge. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 1 and 2. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 14. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
